page.title: 03EDUCATION
page.content: There are two state schools in our area,one in Steeple Ashton,in the High Street and one in Keevil in the Main Street.Both schools were founded by the Church of England; Steeple Ashton in about 1820 and Keevil in about 1870.Both schools are small, under 60 children in each. Most children attend the village schools from the age of five to eleven but some children go to private (fee paying) schools in nearby towns. At the age of eleven children transfer from the village schools to a school in one of the nearby towns:most children go to Clarendon Comprehensive School at Trowbridge.They stay at school until at least sixteen,some until eighteen.At sixteen or eighteen children may leave school and either start work or go on to some further or higher education.
